descriptions:
- Tokenizer tokenizer.py: Character-level or word-level. Fit on text, encode/decode, save/load.
- Model model.py: Small decoder-only transformer GPT-style. Forward → logits; generate → sampled ids.
- Run runllm.py: CLI to fit tokenizer, train, and generate.

headers: 1. Bible Reading Plan (Read the Bible in a Year)

descriptions:
Current Date: January 07, 2026  
Developer: DJMcClellan1966

This README documents the complete conversation and guidance received from Grok xAI throughout the evolution of two related projects:
- PocketFence – A privacy-first parental control app to stay ahead of emerging social media regulations.
- AI-Bible-App – An interactive AI companion for conversing w

A complete, production-ready C# console application that enables users to:
1. Have AI-powered conversations with biblical characters David and Paul
2. Generate personalized daily prayers
3. Save and review conversation and prayer history

The AI-Bible-App now uses Phi-4 running locally via Ollama instead of Azure OpenAI. This provides:
- ✅ True offline capability - no internet required after setup
- ✅ Complete privacy - data never leaves your machine
- ✅ No API costs - free to use
- ✅ Faster responses - local inference depending on h

The AI-Bible-App now features a modern, beautiful user interface built with .NET MAUI Multi-platform App UI, bringing the AI Bible experience to mobile and desktop platforms with a native look and feel.

3. Learning from Production / Change–Incident Correlation (CodeLearn vs. others)
4. Semantic / Lightweight NLP (Semantic Engine vs. others)
descriptions: Short answer: Yes, there are similar apps in use today. This collection sits between lightweight/DIY tooling and enterprise platforms—strong on local-first, no vendor lock-in, and the code–production feedback loop; weaker on scale, language coverage, and managed features.

headers: 5. Evolutionary theory / math (no dedicated repo found)
descriptions: Question: Would experiments from your Desktop evolutionary theory, math, emergence, etc. help improve this app?
Short answer: Yes. Mycelium and Emergence map most directly; Machine-Learning can tighten scoring and anomaly logic.
This doc summarizes code and patterns from other projects on C:\Users\DJMcC\OneDrive\Desktop that could improve this app. Nothing is copied verbatim; these are adaptation ideas.

headers: How to Feed the Kernel (Ingestion API)
Record patterns from a commit (or any source)
Set outcome for a commit (e.g. after deployment or incident)
descriptions: The kernel is the minimal learning core: storage pattern DB, risk/co-occurrence/hub/temporal logic, and a single guidance surface. All ingestion feeds the kernel; all consumption API, pre-commit, CLI reads from it.

headers: How to Tell If the Loop Is Actually Improving
1. What the app actually measures (no hallucination)
2. What the app does *not* do by itself
3. How to verify the numbers (no trust required)
4. How to tell if the loop is *actually* improving over time
descriptions: Short answer: the app does not automatically prove improvement. It gives you numbers; you or your process have to track them over time and compare to reality e.g. incidents. Below is what’s real, what’s not, and how to verify.
A collection of practical AI/ML tools built from the ground up.

descriptions:
- learningapp/ — ML Learning Lab app: app.py, curriculum.py, demos.py, README. Run: python learningapp/app.py → http://127.0.0.1:5001
- MLLearningLab/ — Docs only; app code is in learningapp/

Learn · Decide · Practice · Think · By Book · By Level · Build Knuth Machine

Single-page learning app that integrates MLCompass, optional mltoolbox, and curriculum from Knuth TAOCP, Skiena, Bentley, Sedgewick, textbook concepts, and information/communication theory. Basics to expert, with Learn and Try it per topic, plus Build Knuth Machine pipeline.
Oracle what to do + Explainers why, cross-domain + Theory-as-Channel ensembles + Socratic debate + question. Optional RAG and pattern guidance.
All-encompassing learning app: books, levels, Learn, Try it, Build Knuth Machine.
The app code lives in ../learningapp/ sibling to this folder: curriculum.py, demos.py, app.py, and README.md.

repos.description: problem profile → design pattern → concrete suggestion → “why” in book language.

repos.name: Theory-as-channel
repos.description: Treat the ML pipeline as a communication channel: the “message” is the true label or the teacher’s knowledge; the “channel” is the model(s) or the student; “noise” is prediction error or approximation loss. Shannon’s theory then gives you redundancy (e.g. ensembles) to correct errors and capacity to reason about compression limits.

A simple IDE + Opus-like agent: file tree, editor, and chat with an LLM Ollama qwen3:8b by default that can read files, edit code, run commands, and generate apps—with your approval.

headers: Simple Bible Chat App (Local-First, Ollama + RAG)
descriptions:
This is a local-first web app that lets users chat with Bible characters
Moses, David, Paul, etc. using Retrieval Augmented Generation RAG on
top of a local LLM via Ollama. It runs offline by default, with optional
cloud configuration in the future.
Your AI-Powered Second Brain

A revolutionary personal knowledge platform that combines quantum kernel semantic understanding, AI system reasoning & learning, and LLM generation & synthesis to create the ultimate personal assistant.

Bible Discovery is a Windows‑friendly app for deep, meaningful Bible exploration when you have time. No pressure, no schedule - just pick any passage and explore with insights from Saints Augustine, Aquinas, and modern scholars.
